reviews.review_msg: She seems like a very kind person at first. Despite her strong accent, you have hope for the semester, lured by her seemingly friendly smile. A week later you realize there is no warmth behind her smile. She grins like the Cheshire cat, a cold, mocking smirk. She straight up makes fun of students in class. Lectures are useless, just learn on ur own

shheeeeeee just doesn't get it.. I think she doesn't know why we (the students) are taking classes. She does tend to push her own philosophies and interests on the students (20% project about nanotechnology. This is not a nanotechnology class). You can't really rate her since this is an empty-feeling class. There's no material (no pun intended)

Terrible at teaching. Clearly doesn't understand the material herself. Wastes class time talking about herself and her accomplishments.  Can't answer questions in class. In previous semesters, she has intentionally withheld lecture notes from all students to punish those who no longer attended class. SFU shouldn't be letting this person near students

Class is useless. Ta's are useless. This is probably the most disorganized class i was ever enrolled in. Lectures are full of things you don't even need to know. Ta's don't even teach, just tells you what sections to read. Waste of time.

She's worth a lot of money to SFU, so they keep her around, and are obligated to make her available to students. She's a good entrepreneur, but cannot teach, and does not seem to care about the course. Outlines for labs and assignments were extremely vague, so marks could be lost just by not knowing what they wanted you to do.
Both her and the TA's are useless. Not only that, but it's almost as if they are trying to make your life more unnecessarily difficult by being unorganized and unclear. Unbelievable.

She`s a complete disaster . You are not gonna learn anything in her class, you would just memorize some formulas and try to use them in the exams . She has a bad accent and an extremely bad attitude towards the students . Unfortunately there are no other options for this useless course :(

where should I even start,I dont get why a prof like this still teaches at SFU. Proff and TAs have no background what so ever in Engineering material,they are useless when it comes to answering questions related to the course material.you get spammed by TAS(10 useless emails /week).Just read the book since you wont understand anything dat prof says

Its not the most interesting class and she's not a very good lecturer, but honestly, shes not as bad as some other people have rated her. If you just pay attention in the lectures (which can be hard) and look over all the assignments, you won't have a problem getting atleast a B+/A-.
She is a bad professor as far as I know.

She thinks she is too successful to be here !! She says that SFU begs her to teach this class. The first and last time we went to her office hour, she was eating a sandwich and working with her computer when she answered our question. The answer was: Just read the book, ok?

She is THE worst prof ever. her TA, who doesn?t speak English, teaches this class, so basically useless lectures that is why she gives quizzes every week or else she would be talking to the classroom walls. Everything on the exams is from tutorials. Her accent is unbearable. Speaking English is the least we expect from a prof. COME ONNN SFU!!!!!

Not a good prof. Unfair with grading, so no matter how much you try, the results VARY on how LUCKY you are. I tried hard on this course. The result came out to be getting lower letter grade than my friend who got lower overall marks than me. I complained, both prof and TA don't care.

Her background has nothing to do with materials engineering...and really, that says it all.  I lost 10% of my final grade in that class because when asked for a simple definition of "Iron" (not iron alloy), I didn't mention anything about carbon.

Awful professor with TAs who could care less about their students. She has almost no interest in teaching her students and basically threw a useless book to guide us. Homework assignments are based off the TA tutorials which are basically photography sessions  while the TA asks if we are done yet. Avoid if possible.
Literally the worst prof I've ever had. Lectures are totally useless. She's always making changes to the course without consulting the students. She shouldn't be teaching at all!
She may be good in research but no teaching ability whatsoever.

This'll probably be the easiest 300level class you ever take. The hws are incredibly easy (similar to book examples), and the exams are also like book examples. So I would recommend this teacher if you wanna showoff your grade in a 300level class, but if you actually wanna learn something, DON'T take her:). I got A- but 0 learning from this class..

Her lectures can be enjoyable, and her exams are really, really easy as long as you do the homework. I don't even know what the questions are asking or what they mean, but I just plug in numbers into the formulas, which are given on the exam. My biggest gripe is that the Lab TA is awfully lazy and does not return labs.

I was her TA last year, the course is generally easy, just lots of things to memorize. she cares alot about students if the course is interesting ... overally each student who read the textbook, and assignments got good mark.

She is extremely disorganized and ill-equipped as a teacher. She cannot do anything right and our semester was bunched up at the end. Labs and assignments never returned. Midterm made by a TA (how much was he bribed I wonder). If I had a soul, she just devoured what's left of it.

She is pretty nice actually..it's easy course if she teachs ensc330..if you get other prof..it might be nitemare..since it's 4 credit hour course...buttom line..do your assignments and read the textbook ONCE would be fine

Well, you guys need to know she's POLISH, and not FRENCH -- for sure many ENSC students are ignoramuses. 
 
 She is arrogant I agree, but kinda hot for her age if you want to be fair.
This is one arrogant lady. She thinks she is hot and is not. I got the feeling that she felt certain she was wasting her time with us.
Interesting course material, but can't understand what she is saying, unless you have learned French before.

worst nightmare... she always asks us to "meesure" stuff and dont fall asleep in class...and never actually stop and think that why we fall asleep. she likes to ask questions... but no one knows what she is talking about... probablly some French guys will.
He CANT speak english at all.
no notes, just textbook. take home exams were a nice change though
Unstructured course. Must learn stuff on ur own. Textbook a absolute MUST even if it's only recommended.
Does not treat us like children
Lazy prof!  Can't even speak proper engl. A nonstructure course, learn on ur own
Totally useless guy...
a helpful prof
good afternoon class, lets go swimming!
what can u say...stuff like ensc100. useful or not? man, it's boring...
